N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 §§ 271-6.11 - Drains

State Regulations

Except for properly trapped open sinks, there shall be no
direct connection between the sewerage system and any drains originating from
equipment in which food, portable equipment, or utensils are placed. Inlet
pipes (drain pipes) leading from such water sinks shall have a 1/4 inch or
larger gap between the inlet pipe (drain pipe) and the receiving pipe or
funnel. Where this is impractical, the inlet pipe may extend inside the
receiving pipe provided the fit is loose enough to allow free overflow between
the two fittings. When a warewashing machine is locate within five feet of a
trapped floor drain, the warewasher waste outlet may be connected directly on
the inlet side of a properly vented floor drain trap if permitted by
law. Notes
